an4.130:0.3: Incredible Things About the Wheel-Turning Monarch
an4.130:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these four incredible and amazing things about a wheel-turning monarch.
an4.130:1.3: If an assembly of aristocrats goes to see a wheel-turning monarch, they’re uplifted by seeing him
an4.130:1.4: and uplifted by hearing him speak.
an4.130:1.5: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.
an4.130:4.1: or ascetics goes to see a wheel-turning monarch, they’re uplifted by seeing him
an4.130:4.2: and uplifted by hearing him speak.
an4.130:4.3: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.
an4.130:4.4: These are the four incredible and amazing things about a wheel-turning monarch.
an4.130:5.1: In the same way, there are these four incredible and amazing things about Ānanda.
an4.130:5.3: If an assembly of monks goes to see Ānanda, they’re uplifted by seeing him
an4.130:5.4: and uplifted by hearing him speak.
an4.130:5.5: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.
an4.130:6.1: If an assembly of nuns … laymen … or laywomen goes to see Ānanda, they’re uplifted by seeing him
an4.130:6.2: and uplifted by hearing him speak.
an4.130:6.3: And when he falls silent, they’ve never had enough.
an4.130:6.4: These are the four incredible and amazing things about Ānanda.”
